forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 52. West northwest wind 6 to 9 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 63 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 3 to 14 mph.

weather_report:
As the clock gently ticks into the fresh hours of a new day, Downtown San Francisco finds itself cloaked in a tranquil embrace of mostly clear skies. The air, soft and cool, whispers of a low temperature around 52 degrees, inviting evening strolls where the city lights softly twinkle against the deepening navy of the night. There's a gentle wind from the west-northwest, barely stirring, yet capable of brushing against the cheek like a fleeting memory of warmth. 

Looking ahead, the sun is set to rise with glory on Tuesday, bathing the city in brilliant sunlight. Expect the high to reach a comfortable 66 degrees, gradually cooling to a pleasant 63 by afternoon, perfect for a leisurely lunch outdoors. The wind will pick up slightly, though it remains friendly—dancing through the streets at 3 to 14 mph. This is a day to untangle oneself from the confines of indoor routines; consider visiting the waterfront for an afternoon of reflection or perhaps a quiet café nestled amongst the bustling shops of the Mission. As for attire, layers will serve you well; a light sweater is wise for the morning chill, and a simple shirt or blouse will offer comfort as the sun shines bright. 

With no fog to darken the spirits, the day ahead looks inviting and serene—a lovely opportunity to wander, engage with art, or enjoy a leisurely read in one of the city’s numerous parks.
